intro: Macaranga sphaerophylla, commonly known as the globe-leaf macaranga, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, rounded leaves. The plant is typically found in tropical rainforests and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Its small, yellowish flowers are clustered in inflorescences, and it produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. The species is often used in ecological studies due to its role in supporting various insect and bird species.
